template.text: We're excited to invite security researchers from all backgrounds to help us make [Your Organization] a more secure platform for everyone. Your expertise helps us identify vulnerabilities before they can be exploited, and we value your contributions to our security efforts.
We appreciate reports that can help us improve our security posture. Please review the following details carefully before submitting your findings.

items: Any services hosted by third parties, unless they impact the security of our primary assets.
Missing HTTP security headers (unless they lead to a proven vulnerability)
Reports from automated tools without clear evidence of impact
Theoretical vulnerabilities without proof of exploitation
Provide clear, step-by-step instructions to reproduce the vulnerability
Include screenshots, videos, or code snippets where possible
Test only on your own accounts; do not access others' data
Describe the potential impact and attack scenario
Be respectful of our users' privacy and our systems' stability
We will acknowledge your report within [X] hours/days
A resolution or update will be provided within [X] business days
We will keep you informed about the status of your report
We will recognize your contribution if you wish to be acknowledged

template.text: This program follows a "safe harbor" approach. As long as your research is conducted responsibly and within the program's scope, we consider it authorized. If legal questions arise, we'll work with you to understand and resolve them.

rewards.intro: We offer bounties based on the severity and impact of the vulnerability:
rewards.outro: Note: Reports without clear security implications or that require unrealistic attack scenarios will not be rewarded.

definitions.critical: Full system compromise or large-scale breach
definitions.high: Access to sensitive data or elevated privileges without full compromise
definitions.medium: Abuses that require some user interaction or unusual conditions

examples.critical: Examples: Remote Code Execution (RCE), database access, admin panel access
examples.high: Examples: Privilege escalation, significant data exposure, authentication bypass
examples.medium: Examples: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), CSRF, minor API issues
examples.low: Examples: Information disclosure without direct impact, missing security headers

none.title: No Bounties, Disclosure Only
none.description: Your existing users that find a security bug and decide to raise it. Beginners wishing to raise their reputation on platforms.

entry.title: Entry Level Programs
entry.description: Low to moderate testing interest, primarily from beginners and hobbyists. Best for small startups and initial programs.

growing.title: Growing Programs
growing.description: Moderate testing interest. Suitable for startups and growing companies with more mature security postures.

established.title: Established Programs
established.description: High testing interest from a wide pool of researchers. Suitable for companies with established security teams.

premium.title: Premium Programs
premium.description: Very high testing interest. Suitable for tech-forward organisations that treat bug bounty as a key part of security.

elite.title: Elite Programs
elite.description: Very high testing interest from elite researchers and specialized security teams. Suitable for critical infrastructure and major tech companies.
